reviews.text: I loved the displays here and learned a lot about Brooklyn's history! The staff was friendly and helpful. They are set up with a cute little gift shop as well. Tickets are pay-what-you-can.

This is a very small museum with a lot of history about Prospect Park starting with George Washington fighting the British, slavery, and ending up with the present. Well worth the visit. They have suggested admission. It is an excellent museum for teachers to see with their students.
It's a small museum and a big surprise. Highly recommended if you wonder around in downtown Brooklyn.
ok work job and peresontation verey good car

fresh, relevant, vibrant organization,  representing both our roots and our futures.  
now 2 locations!

The New York Transit Museum, located on 99 Schermerhorn Street in Downtown Brooklyn, is an intricately designed compilation of transportation technology. This technology ranged from standard train cars to the more luxurious forms of transportation like high end train cars with cushioned seats and leather straps hanging from the ceiling of the train for standing passengers. Within each exhibit there is a little bit of history about how the development of transit began and the innovations created to keep people safe who chose to use public transit. This is museum is more than just organized exhibits that are used to display a specified timeline which is hidden behind inches of glass. Rather, this museum is a real life sized interactive experience that you have to see to believe. After visiting this museum and absorbing the knowledge that each exhibit provided, I can honestly say that I urge all New Yorkers in the downtown area to give this museum a shot.

As a lifetime transit buff this was one of the best experiences I had while visiting New York. History will maintain gives us a nice look into what life was like years ago. The fact that they were able to repurpose a subway station added to the field. Excellent photo opportunities abound and a wonderful place to bring along the kids. Enjoy!

This is hands down the best museum that you can see in Brooklyn! I believe it cost $10/person which is an amazing value for all the cool things you get to see. The museum is deceivingly large. You’ll start with the history of the subway (how it was built, mechanisms, and the groups of people and their roles). Then you’ll go into a larger room that goes into the history and evolution of the tracks and routes of the subway. In my opinion, the best is downstairs! You’ll see lots of real life examples of the subway cars with little blurbs about their history and period of use.

Really interesting little museum. The transit systems keep NYC moving so well worth a visit for locals and tourists alike. Don't forget to go downstairs to check out all the train cars through the years!

Small but surprisingly enjoyable (and affordable) museum.  I was hoping they’re have a subway car covered in graffiti but little niggling point considering how well curated it is otherwise. Great for families and adults will have no problem getting into the guts of the fascinating historical aspects.
So good! The food and service was great. Grabbed some pizza and went for a walk along the water. Beautiful weather made the night even better.

Too long of a wait for 4 in afternoon, outside cold and not worth it.  Took an hour.  Limited menu options. No wine or beer options , said they were waiting ?!? One appetizer platter  Service was slow,  family who came in before us was still waiting for their pizza as we paid our bill an hour later.  That being said pizza was good, crispy crust and fresh ingredients.   So if line is short, go on and give it a try,if the line extends through the scaffolding try another day.

New York style pizza and it was pretty good. If this is your first time going they only accept cash, no credit card! The service was decent too. If it is your first time coming to the area, I suggest you try it out!
Great pizza. Wouldn’t wait more than 30 minutes. Not too much selection and cash only. But awesome place

Wait, last time we were here, it wasn't in this location. Oh well, the pizza was good, but the wait was long. Luckily, we decided to make friends with the strangers behind us and get seated quicker as a 4-top. The dining space was tight, but that's part of the experience I guess. We walked the Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan with the purpose of stopping here for dinner, so mission accomplished. I would definitely come back!
Juniors is always great. I recommend eating "lunch". The prices for dinner at extremely high... extremely high. Always try any slice of cake! If you drink alcohol, there is a bar with great service.

A must stop for NY tourists. Best cheesecake and nice dessert bar. Good portion size for meals. Some large enough to share. Plenty of menu options. Some street parking but it's NY and only an hour. Ride subway. Staff is always professional. Prices less than Times Square and reasonable for NY. Don't go there expecting small town prices.

As always the best places are expensive but good for that once in awhile treat. 

Plain cheesecake was delicious doesn't need any fruit toppings.

The lemon meringue slice was huge took me two days to finish. Crust was a little hard but still good. Filling was a bit too sweet. And the foam was just too much, it was 4" high at the center.

Wow things have changed. Inflation is insane. I enjoyed the red velvet cheesecake better than the carrot cake cheesecake. Years ago the single slices were less expensive and bigger. Moving forward will just buy whole cakes.

Still one of my favorite cheesecakes in the game, very rich and nostalgic to any Brooklyn native. Their hot chocolate with whip is also another savory treat. Most of their food is reasonably priced, staff are always cool. I've never had a problem here. If you're a first time visitor do yourself a favor and get a slice of cheesecake.
This place is good, small, and cute inside. We were lucky and didn't have to wait to be seated. We got some of the classic sandwiches on the menu which were definitely satisfying.

Stopped in here on a Saturday before heading to the transit museum. The place is quite tiny and as a party of two we waited about 25 minutes to sit at the bar. The food is incredible. The service was top notch. The potatoes latkes were incredible. The brisket sandwich I got was a bit fatty but I think I just got a bad batch. Tasty though.

Mile end is one of my favorite sandwich shops around. Eating in can be a little snug at times but well worth it. They always have a fun and delicious poutine of the week that never let's me down. They have a very convenient walk up window outside to avoid overfill of the entry. Great for a quick lunch as well as a romantic dinner.

Looking for a good colon cleansing/full body detox? Try one of their sandwiches. It will do wonders to your body and their staff’s lovely attitude will just brighten your day. $17+ for a few slices of corned beef between two pieces of soggy bread and no pickles. Don’t forget to tip your waiter.
We had Christmas dinner here. It is a Jewish deli that served a delicious Chinese Christmas day dinner. It was fun and amazing food.
Good selection, helpful staff & fair pricing.
I LIKE THIS STORE TO BUY RELIGOUS THINGS NOT TO EXPENSIVE

Small place, but most botanicals are small. I just wish they had a larger selection of crystals.Great deals on candles AND washes. Whole bottles of washes for $3. Definitely will be returning for a re-up of supplies. Everyone was very nice, and the Padrino seemed very knowledgeable while helping other people that needed specifics. This was just a supply run for me lol
I been going to this place for years. Great guy and very insightful as well as very spiritual.
The owner is honest and knowledgeable of what you need. Strong spiritual vibe that is good.

They Lie to me NO Vegan Option & Waiting  There for Nothing waste of time at the Table. I Did NOT Like What Was on The Menu & it was Disgusting. So I left quick. I Did not want to be Seen There Either. Because I'm kinda famous. Definitely Not My Type Of Place.

I am vegan and one of my friends who went with me eats halal (my friend enjoyed the lamb). We loved the food and the experience so much that we came back the next night also. The staff and owners are very nice. Next time I am back in Albuquerque I will eat here again.

My favorite Indian food lunch buffet here in Albuquerque.  We make it a point to go meet at least once a month with our friends.  They have all the great stuff you'd expect at a Indian food buffet and they do a great job at all of it.  It's typically bustling and busy at lunch, but with several dining areas and attentive polite staff that are constantly on top of everything, it's always a pleasurable experience.

First time coming here, and first time eating Indian food, and I have to say that I loved it! The location is pretty old and might be in need for an update, but they make up for it with the great food. I went for lunch, and they have their buffet, which makes it really easy to get a sample of their offerings
Always wonderful!  Have been a patron for years, and it's always a good bet.  Had the baked eggplant and lamb meatballs.....great!  Always have an appetizer.

I stumbled upon this beautiful place while walking home from downtown Brooklyn and really enjoyed the peaceful trail in the midst of the busy traffic. This is a nice place to relax and enjoy the sunshine, Reading a book or meditating.
Very nice place to hang out with family and friends. You have nearby the park, boating and  beautiful seanaries
Nice Plaza right across from Prospect Park. Nice place to take pictures and hang out a while. There are a couple of subway stations nearby.
Huge park in Brooklyn. Lots to see on your run or jog, also a great place to take kids
Nice place, nice people Right off Eastern Parkway. Corner of train station is very windy...lol..I lost my shades in the traffic when the wind blew them off my head.Lol

Park is lovely. And amazing in New York City terms. Why do I say that? Since this park in Brooklyn is something you go to for fun day. Many other town it would be just another park. Evening is when everybody comes here. So try mornings...
Love this park, grew up learning how to bike ride, play football, ice skate, sledding. Went on my first carousel ride. Had my best birthday parties. Exploring and "getting lost" is always fun.

Awesome alternative if you get tired of Central Park. Prospect Park is a lot less city-influenced, so you feel nature more here. It’s also less crowded, but still with a beautiful pond/lake and giant meadow. It’s great!

It’s one of the most calm and nice places to relax, from the late afternoon to 1 AM. The 5 stars only applies to after 6:30 PM... when it’s more crowded I’d still give it a 4 star. It’s really worth visiting for a relaxation, but not really as a tourist. Except he needs a calm place for a break. Perfect for a meeting, date, etc
Went there for the Smorgasburg food event, it was great. The park is large and very nice. Plenty of open areas and sports fields. Great place for a picnic!

We absolutely loved our stay here. We spent 2 nights here (8 guests spanning 4 rooms) this past weekend for a wedding that was taking place across the street in Prospect Park. The location was perfect and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. 

It was very clean and the rooms were very spacious along with free fast wifi throughout. If you wanted to stay in, they have plenty, and I mean PLENTY of books to read and movies to watch, along with a beautiful piano in the main living room. And if you want to go out, you are on a perfect spot in Brooklyn close to a variety of places or just for a stroll in the park. 

I would highly recommend this for anyone who wants a cozy place to stay, with literally an 'at home' feel, in Brooklyn, over a hotel any day of the week!

A wonderful place to stay!  It really feels like home. We rented the entire place with our family, including three young children and it was just perfect.  Our hosts Don and Marco were so accommodating and gracious.  The rooms are lovely and comfortable!  Breakfast is just the best....who doesn't love hot croissants to start the day!  You won't be disappointed "At Home in Brooklyn".

This is a spectacularly beautiful and gracious home - one of the prettiest brownstones I've ever seen in NYC, and it's right on Prospect Park, near Grand Army Plaza. Don, the owner of this fabulous B&B, is the ultimate host, greeting everyone and answering all questions. I always book the top floor suite, which is the entire top floor, with a private and very modern bathroom to myself, and a lovely, huge, landscaped terrace with seating for a crowd. The 3 second floor bedrooms share a beautiful and modern bathroom. Those bedrooms are spacious and nicely decorated with period furnishings and art. The breakfasts at "At Home in Brooklyn" are copious and excellent, with smoothies, pastries from the best bakeries in the area, fruit, juice, coffee, cereal, and more. This historic home was artfully updated and converted into a B&B by Don, and he has run it like clockwork for years. I can easily walk to visit my children and grandchildren nearby, and there are also subway stops conveniently located. I can't recommend this "home away from home" enough.

I cannot recommend At Home In Brooklyn highly enough! We booked the whole house for my in-laws during our wedding, and it was perfect. Don could not have been a more gracious or generous host - he was so lovely and welcoming, and went above and beyond to make it an incredible experience for everyone. We even hosted a small rehearsal dinner AND post-wedding brunch on the ground floor, which was a huge bonus. Don helped my mother-in-law set up the brunch and it looked beautiful. Everything was seamless. Location can't be beat - right across from the park and close to so many great shops. We got rave reviews from our family, and it was such a gift to know they were well taken care of for our special event. :)

Pretty close to perfect -- every detail thought through and executed so well.  Really like coming home and being so tended!  And with Prospect Park and the Brooklyn Public Library pretty much just across the street, Franny's only 2 blocks away and an easy subway ride into Manhattan, it's hard to get a better location.

I've enjoyed all of my visits to the new Nitehawk. The prices are reasonable, and the food/drink selection is good. I also like how there are theaters of many different sizes. The small ones add to the intimacy of some films.

Definitely will be coming here to see other movies. Had a fabulous time, love the renovations that were made too. So cool that they have a bar area with seating so you can just sit & enjoy a drink or food if you'd like to before or after the movie. Sorry people have complained about the food/drink service during the movie but in all fairness they all try hard not to disturb you while watching the movie by bending down in front of others. I happen to enjoy the food/drink service !! The drinks are fabulous & food is delicious !!

I love how they remodeled the theater.  I used to go there as a kid, when it was Pavilion,  all the time with my dad and brother.  It's chic and earthy inside. I've noticed two bars,  as well.  The food is delicious, and tastes even better because of awesome customer service.  Finally,  there are various special themed nights,  like all you eat cereal--where you can win gifts.  Magnificent makeover! Go visit!

I was there twice on seances that were beginning from 3 to 4pm.  I can't complain for anything there. Service was good.  There was quite clean. Comfortable seats, a plenty of room. Tables are big enough for a can of soda and for something else. Good sound.
Yes, there is not possible to reserve a seat. But it was not a problem for me because I was there in a daytime and there were numbers of free seats.
I plan visiting Nitehawk soon again.

I like this movie theatre a lot... its movie selection is excellent; the service and bar is good and food is delicious... had a kale salad last nite and was pretty pleased even though it was way overpriced... but its to be expected... The bathrooms on the first floor have the tiniest stalls in the history of bathroom stalls so use second floor facilities if want a bit more room.. otherwise, lovely place to see a movie...

I loved the Brooklyn botanical gardens! I was here in early Spring, when the beautiful cherry blossoms had just kicked off. I can only imagine what the gardens must be like when there are even more flowers. The conservatory has several areas (temperate, desert, tropical) with beautiful plants. There’s also a space dedicated to bonsai trees. The shop will allow you to start your own botanical garden... definitely worth a visit, it’s a lovely way to balance the hectic NY concrete jungle.

My son's class was there for a field trip. It would have been nice to see more flowers in bloom. Some specimens we're blooming but they were more in the ground. It would have been nice if there were types that last year round or bloom in winter. Nice up-keep, but very ordinary.

Brooklyn Botanic Garden was amazing. I went here many times! Recently though, I went to see the cherry blossoms, (only a few have bloomed) and got some nice shots! Also, a hawk lives nearby so I recommend bringing a camera with a long lens if you like to take pictures of birds!

Such a peaceful relaxing atmosphere. There's a couple of eateries so you can have a really good time. The conservatory was blooming. The magnolias we're in bloom and so was the daffodils. There's a newly opened section with a few benches and Boulder seating this is a welcome addition for those with issue sitting on and getting up from the lawns. It is free on Fridays 8am-12pm. It's a must visit to get away from the bustle of the city

I’m sure it’s much more fantastic in the warm months when all is in bloom; but still a tranquil and peaceful place to walk about and enjoy 5he grounds. The indoor spaces are gorgeous too, don’t miss the bonsais. I’ll be back in spring. Loved it here.

Park is lovely. And amazing in New York City terms. Why do I say that? Since this park in Brooklyn is something you go to for fun day. Many other town it would be just another park. Evening is when everybody comes here. So try mornings...
Love this park, grew up learning how to bike ride, play football, ice skate, sledding. Went on my first carousel ride. Had my best birthday parties. Exploring and "getting lost" is always fun.

Awesome alternative if you get tired of Central Park. Prospect Park is a lot less city-influenced, so you feel nature more here. It’s also less crowded, but still with a beautiful pond/lake and giant meadow. It’s great!

It’s one of the most calm and nice places to relax, from the late afternoon to 1 AM. The 5 stars only applies to after 6:30 PM... when it’s more crowded I’d still give it a 4 star. It’s really worth visiting for a relaxation, but not really as a tourist. Except he needs a calm place for a break. Perfect for a meeting, date, etc
Went there for the Smorgasburg food event, it was great. The park is large and very nice. Plenty of open areas and sports fields. Great place for a picnic!

Pretty good ballfields. Not alot of opportunities for shade in the summer if you are watching games on 1, 2 and 3. Not many concessions or places to sit either. It's usually a peaceful crowd and I haven't witnessed any problems or out of control individuals. The fields are very rough when wet, so if it rains games are unplayable.
Needs more bathrooms, but the natural beauty and field conditions are very good.
Neat green space on a regular day but it really comes to life during special events. The recent summer performance by the NY Philharmonic Orchestra was amazing!
Nice area for baseball games. The field is pretty well maintained. Lots of area to sit around or even have a picnic for the Spring or Summer time.
Nothing better than watching kids play baseball on a beautiful, spring afternoon

Park is lovely. And amazing in New York City terms. Why do I say that? Since this park in Brooklyn is something you go to for fun day. Many other town it would be just another park. Evening is when everybody comes here. So try mornings...

It’s one of the most calm and nice places to relax, from the late afternoon to 1 AM. The 5 stars only applies to after 6:30 PM... when it’s more crowded I’d still give it a 4 star. It’s really worth visiting for a relaxation, but not really as a tourist. Except he needs a calm place for a break. Perfect for a meeting, date, etc
Went there for the Smorgasburg food event, it was great. The park is large and very nice. Plenty of open areas and sports fields. Great place for a picnic!
Quality ingredients and great service! Bathroom was super clean so that means they are clean with their food. Great service. Price super affordable.

This is by far my favorite Chinese food in the area. It's not the most authentic but everything they serve is always fresh and tasty. The house lo mein and the bone in spare ribs are fantastic. As far as Chinese food goes in the Park Slope area this is certainly the best. Great service and an extremely friendly staff too.
Very good standard Chinese food! Delivery always reliable , love the veg wonton soup with spinach and shrimp dumplings... very good comfort food :)
Great food, fast friendly service.
I love their Dan Dan noodles and hot pepper beef. Also their chili wontons, my faves!
I ordered the meat platter, comes with rice and veggies. Choice of soup or salad an add'l $3. Price is around $17 with add on. Love Mediterranean food, tasty and  just feels well-balanced.

Got takeout during off peak hours. The falafel was fried to order and made with fresh herbs. Excellent hummus and baba ganoush—the grilled eggplant was nice and smoky. Warm friendly service to top it all off.

Ordered chicken, rice and babaganush instead of vegetable 
They didn’t give me rice and changed extra for babaganush
Chicken kebab was more like just a grilled chicken and super salty 
I’m very upset because I payed more to enjoy babaganush + rice combination and didn’t get it
Best food ever! From their lentil soup, to their moussaka, falafel, chicken cutlet is amazing. Highly recommend.
Good middle eastern fare, freshly prepared and reasonably priced. Can be slow on a busy day, but not today.  Definitely worthwhile.

Park is lovely. And amazing in New York City terms. Why do I say that? Since this park in Brooklyn is something you go to for fun day. Many other town it would be just another park. Evening is when everybody comes here. So try mornings...
Love this park, grew up learning how to bike ride, play football, ice skate, sledding. Went on my first carousel ride. Had my best birthday parties. Exploring and "getting lost" is always fun.

Went there for the Smorgasburg food event, it was great. The park is large and very nice. Plenty of open areas and sports fields. Great place for a picnic!

Amazing service from Johanna!!! She was so attentive to us. We came for boozy brunch and she let us know from the beginning that she would give us as many drinks as she could throughout the day. She also gave us amazing recs for food. The food was amazing! Very authentic! Honestly if I come back, which I definitely will, I will ask for her as my waitress!!! So amazing
Amazing (and wide variety of) gluten free dishes. Magical cocktails. Really happy that they expandedd their happy hour menu.

The happy hour drinks were watered down, but the empanadas were banging especially the guava one. Man it was good. It’s a cute little restaurant with great servers. I would definitely love to visit again
One of my favorite spots! From food, to drinks to the friendly service....love this place! Oh, and family friendly!!

Coquito, Flan, Snapper with Coconut Shrimp. Amazing meal and staff. Loved it all.  New Years Eve was packed but the staff was respectful smiling and ready to take care of everyone.  Can't wait to go back and enjoy another great meal. Thank you to the staff..

Park is lovely. And amazing in New York City terms. Why do I say that? Since this park in Brooklyn is something you go to for fun day. Many other town it would be just another park. Evening is when everybody comes here. So try mornings...
Love this park, grew up learning how to bike ride, play football, ice skate, sledding. Went on my first carousel ride. Had my best birthday parties. Exploring and "getting lost" is always fun.

Awesome alternative if you get tired of Central Park. Prospect Park is a lot less city-influenced, so you feel nature more here. It’s also less crowded, but still with a beautiful pond/lake and giant meadow. It’s great!

It’s one of the most calm and nice places to relax, from the late afternoon to 1 AM. The 5 stars only applies to after 6:30 PM... when it’s more crowded I’d still give it a 4 star. It’s really worth visiting for a relaxation, but not really as a tourist. Except he needs a calm place for a break. Perfect for a meeting, date, etc
Went there for the Smorgasburg food event, it was great. The park is large and very nice. Plenty of open areas and sports fields. Great place for a picnic!

Yuko Nii and Terry Lindall have given the Brooklyn art community an outstanding gift through the establishment of the WAH center and the Yuko Nii Foundation. Their dedication, passion, and support is deeply felt the moment one steps into the gorgeous space that is the WAH center. It is one of the gems of North Brooklyn, and I couldn't image the neighborhood without it. Do visit and support generously.
Awesome art showcase Gallery in the hart of Williamsburg in a Historical Landmark Building.

reviews.author_name: How To Make Friends Like Me Frens4u
reviews.text: Am important artistic place, nice to be, beautiful, a good atmosphere, highly recommend!

This museum is closed. We went during advertised business hours and it was all locked up, gate chained closed, and totally dark. There was a hand written sign to ring the bell on the side door but no one came.
Williamsburg's artistic treasure.

If you are a true art lover with an appreciation for creativity and street art you'll love the Bushwick Collective. There are so many different art pieces to check out it's easy to miss some. It's well worth the trip to take in all the truly inspirational pieces by the amazing artists that have contributed.

MUST SEE! This is real street art , amazing canvas and portraits . Every time I drive by , It gives me like positive energy . It makes my day look brighter. I just love looking at the colorful streets making wish I had the same talent as the arts .

I am keen into art and street art in particular. This is one of my favourite places in the whole NYC along The High Line park and some other venues. The Bushwick Collective is abundant in graffities of all kinds. To my mind, these are intelligent and touching pieces of art. I love spending my time in this part of Bushwick. Take some time and explore an amazing corner of NYC. I am not an artist and I can't draw or paint, however, I admire street art like the one displayed in the Bushwick Collective. It is totally worth devoting some time to spend there an hour or so. I recommend.

I lived in NY for almost nine years. The day before I moved back home someone very special took me on a walking tour of my old neighborhood. The energy, the people, the art, the culture...all portrayed through the colors and canvas that is Bushwick. So much artistry in a few short blocks. The collection is a must for those who love street art, or art in general.
We enjoy walking in this neighborhood checking out the great artwork/graffiti. So colorful and creative. We often take plenty of pictures.
The pizza is very Neapolitan style with well done crusts. Lots of options, delicious salads and antipastos. Fair prices, not that crowded; a neighborhood gem.
Excellent food, excellent prices and excellent service, they have a nice server Sal I think, he is the best!! 100% recommended

Great time and good food! As soon as you walk in you can feel the wood fire oven cooking, keeping you cozy. Pizza is excellent and wine choices feature some key off the menu options. Suggest a back table for a more intimate atmosphere where one can discuss hobbies, future plans, positional preferences, and merits of mature oocyte preservation.
The calzones are massive but pretty good! The cheese was fresh and the service was pretty quick.
Some of the best pizza in Brooklyn. Ingredients are fresh and the quality of the crust is excellent.

Food: great. 
Service: inexplicably fast. 
Drinks: tasty with a good variety. 
Decor: nice and stylish. It's a huge place and it doesn't look too crowded it nor too sparse. 
Ambiance: it's dim. I was not the only one using their phone just to read the menu.
Sound level: Ever wanted to eat in a night club? Now you can! High bass house music played all night, and it ruined the otherwise relaxed atmosphere this place has, enough to lose 2 stars.

TL;DR: never coming here again

The service is really good. It’s very lively club/restaurant/bar. The food came out quick, everything was delicious. The prices are good and beer is reasonably priced for the area. If you have reservations don’t expect them to be punctual with time, it’s so popular so I can understand why.  There’s also a bar area near the entrance and the most interesting bathroom setup I’ve seen.

Nice decor. Ambiance. But, the food is disappointing. Pad Thai is rather sweet than said, not spicy all. Pork chop is sweet. Papaya salad is disappointing, I wish they used real lime juice instead of fake ones. Eggplant basil, there was more other veggies than eggplant. The 6 0’ clock spicy fries was good but not spicy at all. The only good part about this dinner experience was Brooklyn lager beer 😁 my beer 🍻
Had a great experience here for my friend’s birthday! It was fun and the food was amazing! The wait was a little long even with reservations but it’s kind of worth it because the food is delicious!

Not a bad place go, especially on a Sunday afternoon. It wasn't crowded at all. The staff was friendly and attentive. Wasn't to crazy about the drinks. Except for the Thai Mule which was very good, The King, and Tut Tut Fun shot tasted more like juice than alcohol. As for the food, The Walnut Shrimp was very good. The Pork Chop was very tender, and the Red Snapper was prepared well. The Atmosphere was very different, compared to most restaurants. Definately felt like I was in a different country. Not bad!

Lovely spot! The atmosphere is so lovely both inside and out and the food is fabulous as well. It’s so rare to find a gem like this. The food wasn’t just beautiful- it was fresh, delicious and creative. I don’t think you can go wrong with any of their dishes! Well done!
This place was insanely delicious. Came with a group and ordered a mixed bag of I-don't-even-know and was floored by every dish. Even the string beans were distinctly delicious. Absolutely amazing.

My friends and I came here for breakfast. The pancakes were huge. I tried some of my friend’s eggs, avocado, bacon, and hash browns too. I might say the savory was better than the sweet. The staff was nice enough to put a birthday candle in the pancakes for my friend’s 3 year old’s birthday. I’d be interested in checking out the lunch but I’ve heard it gets quite busy. Cool ambiance.

Like their crowd, typical American restaurant. Trendy retro. Ordered burger , was huge and tasty indeed.
Good place to sit and talk

My husband and I came here for brunch after several recommendations from friends. They space was small and loud with not very much elbow room, so we opted to sit outside! The food was good. My husband got the ricotta pancakes, since they were recommended to us. They were delicious, no complaints at all! Some of the best pancakes I've ever had. I got the sage scrambled egg sandwich with a side of truffle fries. The fries were great. All breakfast food, although slightly overpriced, was enjoyable. We will be back!
